snippet: A Bronx nursing home operator died in custody, but through her estate, she is still making amends for cheating the health program.
abstract: New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman's office reaches settlement with estate of Brooklyn nursing home operator Helen Sieger, who was arrested in 2009 on charges of bribing a hospital social worker to steer patients to her nursing home; settlement, which will pay $2.5 million to state’s Medicaid program, includes $1.2 million in reimbursements and $1.3 million for damages; Sieger died in custody in 2011.
lead_paragraph: A Bronx nursing home operator died in custody, but through her estate, she is still making amends for cheating the health program.

headline.seo: New York State Gets $2.5 Million in Medicaid Fraud Case
headline.main: New York State Gets $2.5 Million in Medicaid Fraud Case
headline.print_headline: $2.5 Million to State in Medicaid Fraud Case
